issues.description: The StockIngredient constructor signature is inconsistent: the problem statement UML and the template Main.java examples use a 3-parameter constructor StockIngredient(String, int, int), but the templateâ€™s StockIngredient class only defines a 4-parameter constructor StockIngredient(String, int, int, boolean). Students cannot instantiate StockIngredient as described in the problem.
issues.suggested_fix: Add an overloaded 3-parameter constructor public StockIngredient(String name, int price, int quantity) to the template StockIngredient class (or adjust the UML and Main examples to use the existing 4-parameter signature), so that students can instantiate StockIngredient(name, price, quantity) as specified.
